page.title: 10Blisland Village Hall
page.content: Blisland Village hall is next door to the council houses which are called Pentor.The building was built in 1929. Some of the foundation stones were put there by the Rector and Mrs Vernon Morshead,Mrs Edward Collins,Mrs Lasseter,W Nelder, Mr and Mrs A.H Ledger and Mrs J Lean on July 13th 1929.All these people lived in the Parish.The village hall is used most of all on Mondays.The village hall is used for W.I.,Tapdancing,Doctor,Over Sixties Club, Wedding receptions, Discos and parties. The Doctor comes on Monday mornings. The building has 12 doors and 18 windows. If you go down some steps you come to a kitchen.
